1.text: Choose bell peppers that are ripe and crisp.

2.text: Rinse the surface of the bell peppers in cool running water.

3.text: Cut them in half with a sharp knife.

4.text: Cut them in vertical strips or dice them, depending upon how you like to use bell peppers in recipes.

5.text: Find a cookie sheet that will fit in your freezer.

6.text: Cover the cookie sheet with parchment paper or wax paper to prevent the vegetables from sticking to the tray.

7.text: Spread out your strips or your diced bell peppers.

8.text: Flash freeze the peppers by placing them inside the freezer.

9.text: Leave them in the freezer for 30 minutes to one hour.

10.text: Lift the bell peppers from the parchment paper with a spoon or flat spatula.

11.text: Pour the peppers into small freezer bags, approximately one-half to one cup (90 to 175 g) at a time.

12.text: Squeeze all the air out of the freezer bag.

13.text: Label the bag with the contents and date.

14.text: Store the vegetables in your freezer for up to eight months.
